channel.title: The Moth Podcast
channel.description: Since its launch in 1997, The Moth has presented thousands of true stories, told live and without notes, to standing-room-only crowds worldwide. Moth storytellers stand alone, under a spotlight, with only a microphone and a roomful of strangers. The storyteller and the audience embark on a high-wire act of shared experience which is both terrifying and exhilarating. Since 2008, The Moth podcast has featured many of our favorite stories told live on Moth stages around the country. For information on all of our programs and live events, visit themoth.org.

item.title: Lynnee Breedlove & Jama Jack
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: Lynnee Breedlove creates “Homobiles” — a ride service serving the LGBT community and others marginalized by society. Jama Jack contemplates her choice between Christianity and Islam.
item.content:encoded: Lynnee Breedlove creates “Homobiles” — a ride service serving the LGBT community and others marginalized by society. Jama Jack contemplates her choice between Christianity and Islam.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lynnee Breedlove creates “Homobiles” -- a ride service serving the LGBT community and others marginalized by society. Jama Jack contemplates her choice between Christianity and Islam.

item.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Holiday Special 2015
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: A special holiday edition of The Moth Radio Hour: A family tradition endures community-wide scandal, a single woman tries to find her soulmate for Hanukkah, a daughter honors her mother’s last Christmas wish, a guard works New Year’s Eve at Sing Sing prison, and the holiday spirit fills an emergency room. Storytellers: Tricia Rose Burt, Amy Klein, Alexandra […]
item.content:encoded:
A special holiday edition of The Moth Radio Hour: A family tradition endures community-wide scandal, a single woman tries to find her soulmate for Hanukkah, a daughter honors her mother’s last Christmas wish, a guard works New Year’s Eve at Sing Sing prison, and the holiday spirit fills an emergency room.

Storytellers: Tricia Rose Burt, Amy Klein, Alexandra Rosas, Ted Conover, and Matthew Dicks.
item.itunes:subtitle: A special holiday edition of The Moth Radio Hour: A family tradition endures community-wide scandal, a single woman tries to find her soulmate for Hanukkah, a daughter honors her mother's last Christmas wish,
item.itunes:summary:
A special holiday edition of The Moth Radio Hour: A family tradition endures community-wide scandal, a single woman tries to find her soulmate for Hanukkah, a daughter honors her mother's last Christmas wish, a guard works New Year's Eve at Sing Sing prison, and the holiday spirit fills an emergency room.
Storytellers: Tricia Rose Burt, Amy Klein, Alexandra Rosas, Ted Conover, and Matthew Dicks.
item.itunes:author: The Moth

item.title: Eve Plumb & The Pittsburgh StorySLAM
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: Eve Plumb reflects on the real-life and TV families from her childhood, and a slide show on a family trip goes awry.
item.content:encoded: Eve Plumb reflects on the real-life and TV families from her childhood, and a slide show on a family trip goes awry.
item.itunes:subtitle: Eve Plumb reflects on the real-life and TV families from her childhood, and a slide show on a family trip goes awry.

item.title: Amir Baghdadchi & Dameon Wilburn: StorySLAM Favorites
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: Amir has a “chat” with a government agent in a windowless room at the airport, and Dameon takes a trip to Paris. Storytellers: Amir Baghdadchi and Dameon Wilburn.
item.content:encoded:
Amir has a “chat” with a government agent in a windowless room at the airport, and Dameon takes a trip to Paris.

Storytellers: Amir Baghdadchi and Dameon Wilburn.

item.title: The Moth Radio Hour: The Moth StorySLAM
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: In this hour we’ll travel around the country to hear stories from our live open mic StorySLAM events: Louisville, Kentucky; San Francisco; Burlington, Vermont; Portland, Oregon; as well as the birthplace of the Moth StorySlam, New York City. Storytellers: John Dubuc, Leah Benson, Kathi Kinnear Hill, Tom Herndon, Caitlin Myer, David Sampliner, and Tara Clancy.
item.content:encoded:
In this hour we’ll travel around the country to hear stories from our live open mic StorySLAM events: Louisville, Kentucky; San Francisco; Burlington, Vermont; Portland, Oregon; as well as the birthplace of the Moth StorySlam, New York City.

Storytellers: John Dubuc, Leah Benson, Kathi Kinnear Hill, Tom Herndon, Caitlin Myer, David Sampliner, and Tara Clancy.
